findings.title: Contract owner can arbitrarily modify _uniswapProxy while users potentially have pending transactions
findings.description: The contract owner can modify `_uniswapProxy` at any time, which may cause users with pending transactions to execute on a different proxy contract than expected.

findings.title: UniswapV2.sol: Missing implementation for onChainSwap() leads to loss of funds
findings.description: Function `onChainSwap()` is currently missing the implementation required for the actual swapping of tokens (currently commented out in code). A call to this function that sends ETH will result in loss of all the funds sent.

findings.title: Implementation discrepancy for function withdrawAllWETH()
findings.description: Function `withdrawAllWETH()`'s documentation states that it sends the `WETH` returned during the exchange to the user, while its implementation simply converts the contract's `WETH` back to ETH.

findings.title: AugustusSwapper might misbehave with some ERC-20 tokens
findings.description: Some ERC-20 implementations may cause unexpected consequences, such as tokens that charge fees on transfer, malicious implementations, or tokens that return false instead of reverting.

findings.title: Code duplication
findings.description: There is a lot of duplicate code throughout the codebase.

findings.title: Function _destroyChildren() does not check if value equals zero
findings.description: The function `_destroyChildren()` does not check if `value` equals zero, resulting in unnecessary instructions being executed and gas wasted when this is the case.
